titles.title: Permanently Inhibit Gougers Act
To prohibit price gouging of products and services that are widely needed during a designated disaster.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 10/2/2003--Introduced. Permanently Inhibit Gougers Act - Declares that it shall be unlawful for commercial vendors in areas designated as disaster areas to raise the price of products or services that are widely needed in such area by more than ten percent above the average retail price charged by that vendor during the preceding 90 days for them. Directs the Federal Trade Commission to prescribe implementing regulations. Sets forth a maximum civil penalty amount. Provides for a private right of action for violations of this Act.
